Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
A header name of a task. "Calling of Bravery" is the name of a competition.

You can win this map by finding and protecting the Oathbound Settlements, while earning a higher Reputation than the other contending Paladins.[br/][br/]Settlements Secured: {INT_0}/{INT_1}[br/]Your Reputation: {INT_2}
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'. For "Paladin" see the corresponding glossary entry.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
A header name of a task. For "Seer" see the corresponding glossary entry. "Vrascal" is the first name of a male Oathbound character.
Vrascal the Seer must survive. If you lose your judge of honor, it will surely fall back on you. The protection of the planet would become another Paladin's duty, making you lose the mission.
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
The Oathbound settlers were supposed to send a delegation to your welcome. They aren't answering your transmissions either. Send your scouts to their Settlements to find out if they are in trouble.

Each step on a planet blessed by the sedulous presence of the populace feels like a breath of fresh air. Watching the land unfold in meadows and lush fields stretching far to the horizon instills me with a sense of peace that I haven’t felt in a long time.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

It reminds me of the fifth noble command in the Code d’Equise: “A Paladin must at all times value and protect the work of the common man. For who will bake the bread without flour? Or grind the flour from an empty granary when the farmer to work the fields was driven from his land and murdered in tyranny?”[br/][br/]Wouldn’t you agree that this is indeed our honest duty, Vrascal?

Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female) "Code d'Equise" is the name of the Paladin code of honor. It is derived from the paladin title "Equis" (see corresponding glossary entry).

I am not tasked with agreeing or disagreeing with anything you might say, young Examinee. My role as a judge of honor is to observe, not to interfere, and right now I am observing that the Paladins of the Equisat of Verdrice have not kept our appointment, with none of their representatives in sight.

Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male) "Equisat of Verdrice" is the name of the planet. "Equisat" is the name the Oathbound give to planets ruled by an "Equis". "Verdrice" is the last name of a male Oathbound character.

The settlements… you are right. We haven’t heard back from any of them ever since we landed. Let us hope that their silence is caused by a technical failure and that your quick judgment of character will turn out to have been premature once their representatives arrive.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

A Seer never judges prematurely. The wisdom of Oracle makes sure of that.[br/][br/]Just remember that the judges on the other planets will compile their own chronicle of deeds, and that your reputation will be weighed against that of the other contestants when the time to end the Calling of Bravery has come.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male) For "Oracle" see the corresponding glossary entry.

I shall keep that in mind, Vrascal, thank you. But I already received my greatest reward when I was entrusted with the safety of the people on this planet. If we accept this strife as the friendly competition that it is, we will all be winners!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
A header name of a task.

A true Paladin is measured by their selfless acts and bravery. Reaching a virtuous reputation will prove that you can take care of your people.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: to increase your reputation, make peace and later alliances with NPC factions or other players and help the population of the Oathbound settlements with their problems.)[/recommendedcol]
A task description. "Reputation" is an in game concept, "Virtuous reputation" is the highest level of reputation a player can achieve.
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.

The streets of this settlement are deserted, some of the houses overgrown and uninhabitable. The Oathbound only arrived here two years ago, yet it looks as if the local decay has been going on for decades.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

A Paladin protector! Thank the wisdom of the Seers and Oracle! Your observations are right on point, oh bringer of safety and hope. The rot that has infested this village is not natural in its quickness or shape. It started with animating my pottery, turning them into wandering nightmares of clay. But soon more dangerous objects and machinery were stalking the streets.
Story message. Speaker: "Harald the Potter" (Oathbound, male)

By that time, the steward of our village had begun to investigate the problem. She said that there was no vile magic involved, but that a rapidly growing mushroom had taken hold of our farming equipment. When she failed to return from her last expedition, we were left defenseless against these fungal invaders.
Story message. Speaker: "Harald the Potter" (Oathbound, male) "Steward" is the title of a Paladin governing a colony.
You shall be defenseless no longer, brave citizen! Let it be known that the new Equis of this planet has arrived and that he will not rest until your village is safe once more.
You shall be defenseless no longer, brave citizen! Let it be known that the new Equis of this planet has arrived and that she will not rest until your village is safe once more.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

The people of Dammaster are threatened by a very lively plague of living fungi, taking over farming equipment as weapons! The local Paladin went out to face the pests but never returned. You need to eradicate the plague.

Those Mycelians are the strangest enemies I ever had to face on the field of battle. Hopefully that’s all of them in this vicinity. Now the real feat will be to find where they are spreading from, to root out the source of this plague.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Our steward said a very similar thing, before she went out on her last expedition. She didn’t share any details of her findings, but we do know that she was heading for Shroomwood Forest. Be careful.
Story message. Speaker: "Harald the Potter" (Oathbound, male) "Shroomwood Forest" is the name of an in game sector.
Go to the Shroomwood Forest to find the source of the Mycelian plague.
Equis {STR_LeaderName}! Our scrying drones have scanned the forest. It seems to be entirely swamped with Mycelians. What are your orders for the attack?
"Combine forces for a quick alpha strike.”
"Ignite the forest and fry the mushrooms for dinner."
Consult with Vrascal before you respond.
We managed to push through the first wave of Mycelians we encountered. But then the rest of the fungi retreated into the heart of the forest, as if driven by some deep instinct.
So much for our element of surprise. I guess now we’ll have to settle with the good old heroic charge against overwhelming odds.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

We’ve set fire to the forest, killing a few of the Mycelians as the flames spread. But then the rest of the fungi retreated into the heart of the forest and released a spore cloud which protected them from the fire. The spores are now polluting the entire area.
Sounds like this part of the plan didn’t work out so well! Let’s see if we can contain this new health hazard before it starts to spread.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Our targets are many in numbers and dangerous to face on our own. I am counting on your wisdom, Vrascal, to give us an edge in this upcoming fight – do you have any insight to share with me?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

You do well in seeking my council, Examinee {STR_LeaderFirstName}, but the advice I can share is not my own. It stems from the collective efforts of all Seers and from the eternal wisdom of Oracle.[br/][br/]Let your colonies sweeten their grain and refine it into a nectar-like mush. Use it to fill a natural pond at Forlorn Peaks and your Mycelian problem will be handled.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male) "Forlorn Peaks" is the name of an in game sector.
I am not sure I can follow you, Vrascal; how would any of this help me in killing off the Mycelian plague?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
The connections between the currents of reality are not easy to grasp without the accumulated knowledge of a Seer. Trust in my advice and you will not fail.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)
Destroy the source of the Mycelian plague.
Destroy the source of the Mycelian plague.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: remove a hazard in a sector before engaging in any high risk battles within that sector.)[/recommendedcol]
Vrascal gave you a different suggestion to deal with the Mycelian threat. He wants you to fabricate a sweet grain mush and fill it in a pond at Forlorn Peaks.
A sugary mush refined from the grain harvested by your colonies.
Fill a natural pond in the Forlorn Peaks with sweet grain mush.
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
The mush we spread seems to be attracting hordes of bombardons from all over! I’ve never seen that many in a single location.[br/][br/]I wonder what is going to happen next…
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

The excrement left by the feasting bombardons dripped into the river, which carried it downhill into the Shroomwood Forest, and there – I don’t believe it – the acidic goo is dissolving even the metal parts of the Mycelian compound. Disgusting, yet effective. Their numbers have been completely decimated!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female) "Shroomwood Forest" is the name of an in game sector.
It is beyond me how you could have predicted such a coincidence, Vrascal, but remind me to never doubt your advice again, even when it may sound absurd!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

This place bears the marks of Entropy. The Mycelians themselves didn’t show any signs of such deep corruption, so likely whatever happened here only attracted them.[br/][br/]Aspirants, did any of you find the remains of the valiant steward from the village of Dammaster?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female) "Dammaster" is the name of a colony.

We have retrieved this key, engraved with the emblem of Dammaster, Equis {STR_LeaderName}. Sadly, it seems to be the only thing still left of the steward. Not even a scrap of her battlesuit, as far as we could gather.
Alas, then we cannot give her the burial she would have deserved. But at least the village of Dammaster should be more secure now.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
The gates of this settlement are closed, its walls decorated with uprooted bad weed of all different kinds. How very strange…
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Laugh about our scaregrowths all you want, foreigner, but if your home village was besieged by vengeful plants, you too would try anything to keep them at bay. These weird psychoplants seem to be so sensitive that they can’t even stand a snapped off flower!
Story message. Speaker: "Laddon the Farmer" (Oathbound, male) "scaregrowth" is a scarecrow built to scare away the Growth faction (sentient plants).

You are having trouble with the Growth as well, then? This would explain a thing or two. But worry not, brave citizen! I am the new Equis on this planet, and I have come to get to the root of this problem.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

A Paladin protector? These are great tidings! Though there is little hope for a quick resolution of the current situation. The Growth has been hostile to us farmers ever since we harvested our first crop. They seem to see it as some kind of murder.
Story message. Speaker: "Laddon the Farmer" (Oathbound, male)

Our steward managed to keep the plants in check whenever they threatened the fields, but then he made the noble attempt to negotiate with the Growth and visit their Mothernode. He never returned from that journey.
Story message. Speaker: "Laddon the Farmer" (Oathbound, male) "Mothernode" is the name of the Growth mother plant on a planet.
How horrible! Did you ever send anyone out to learn if he was still alive?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

All the men and women brave enough to face such danger went with the steward on his diplomatic mission. Those of us who remained are happy, if we can manage to keep resisting the vicious Growth within the walls of our own village.
Story message. Speaker: "Laddon the Farmer" (Oathbound, male)
I understand. The situation has been grim. Let me take care of the immediate threat first, and then I shall see if I can learn anything about the steward’s fate.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

The farmers of Norzedaal are in constant war with the Growth, who turned hostile as soon as the settlers started to harvest their first crops. Start helping them by picking off the Growth in the immediate vicinity.
A task description. "Norzedaal" is the name of a colony.

In the future I’ll think twice when anybody offers to gift me a bouquet. Who would have thought that roses could have such thorns?[br/][br/]Now we need to prepare to face the Mothernode. We owe it to the steward of Norzedaal!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
The Paladin steward of Norzedaal went out to negotiate with the Mothernode in an attempt to reach a more permanent peace with the Growth. He never returned. You need to finish what he started.

Equis {STR_LeaderName}! Our scrying drones maneuvered through the thicket of the tangle all the way to the Mothernode. You will not believe it, but they found the steward of Norzedaal dozing peacefully amid the jungle of thorny tendrils and vines! How do you wish we proceed?
Story message. Speaker: "Aspirant" (Oathbound unit, male) "Scrying drones" refers to the Scryer unit of the Oathbound.
Say you will handle it from here (a long sleep like this is usually ended by a kiss, right?).
Consult with Vrascal before you respond.

The rescue team cautiously made their way into the overgrown maze at the heart of the Mothernode. But now they need your guidance on how to move forward. It seems that whichever direction they go, the Growth adds a new barrier to its tangled labyrinth.

We need to act with caution and not further provoke the Growth, if we want to get the steward of Norzedaal out there alive. This is why I will go in alone. The outer areas of the jungle seem fairly maneuverable. Only the heart of the Mothernode looks like an authentic maze.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

We need to act with caution and not further provoke the Growth, if we want to get the steward of Norzedaal out of the Mothernode tangle alive. Do you have any advice, Vrascal, on how to navigate through this dense labyrinth?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
No advanced thinking or knowledge is needed to solve this new problem of yours, Examinee {STR_LeaderFirstName}. Let a scryer map the area for you. It will surely find you a safe way of passage.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)
You are right, Vrascal, thank you. Sometimes I am too forgetful about the marvels that our technology can provide. I will ready a Scryer to send it into the tangle.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
The steward of Norzedaal is still alive! He is sleeping at the heart of the Mothernode tangle. You need to go in and wake him up without further enraging the Growth that could crush him.
Venture into the mothernode tangle to rescue the steward of Norzedaal.
Vrascal suggested to you to let a Scryer map the path through the Mothernode tangle. This way it might get much easier to make your way to the center.
Use a Scryer to get an overview of the tangle's outlay.
Area surveillance completed. Pathfinding algorithm conclusive - two safe routes identified:[br/][br/](1) West, west, up, up, east, up, east.[br/](2) Up, east, up, up, west.
Story message. Speaker: "Scryer" (Oathbound drone unit, genderless)

(You enter the heart of the Mothernode thicket. Only sparse light makes its way through the dense jungle of roots, trunks and vines.[br/][br/]You know that the steward of Norzedaal is sleeping at one of the tangle’s peaks. Where do you go?)
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.
(You reach a pond filled with crystalline water. Droplets of a sweet liquid are drippling down the canopy of leaves, moistening the entire area.)
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.
(Colorful blossoms entwine each other in pairs, forming lush pillars of colossal beauty. Sadly, they are also emitting a unique, intense stink.)
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.
(A thick wall of thorny vines is blocking your passage. After fruitless attempts to cut a pathway, you are in need of rest and return to your camp.){MSTR_MAZE_FAILURE_TEXT}
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.
[br/][br/][recommendedcol]You can re-enter the maze once per turn to try again.[/recommendedcol]
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.
(There are natural furrows in the swampy ground. Most of them are filled with what you suspect to be hatches of Bombardon spawn.)
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description. "Bombardon" is the name of an in game unit.

(Sweet nectar is brimming over the honeycomb of the Growth Worker Bee. The bees themselves are startled by the intrusion, and pursue you in an angrily humming swarm until you reach the edge of the tangle.){MSTR_MAZE_FAILURE_TEXT}
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description. "Worker Bee" is the name of an in game unit.

(The air in this meadow amongst the trees is glimmering with purple clouds of pollen. You notice you are feeling sleepier with each passing moment, so you quickly retreat back to the entrance of the living maze.){MSTR_MAZE_FAILURE_TEXT}
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.
(Butterflies of various shapes and colors are flitting and flapping around the canopy. Their playful activity is a beautiful sight to behold.)
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.
(One of the tendrils hanging down from above has formed a natural sling, as if it wanted to invite you to take a spin.)
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.

(A mighty snore makes the roots and vines tremble, revealing the presence of a gigantic Voradon resting amid the tangle. Waking it up would be a deadly mistake, so you sneak back to base camp before harm finds its way.){MSTR_MAZE_FAILURE_TEXT}
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description. "Voradon" is the name of an in game unit.

(One moment the overgrown thicket is too dense to let much light through, the next moment a gap opens up, making you stumble over the brink of the green abyss. You slide down a particularly large tendril, all the way to the maze’s entrance.){MSTR_MAZE_FAILURE_TEXT}
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.
(This comb of the tangle is home to a Kir’Ko Larvae. A colony of ants seems to have adopted it as its queen, constantly feeding their oversized monarch in a collective effort.)
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description. "Larvae" refers to the in game Kir'Ko unit "Emergent".
(Toxic spore clouds are poisoning this area at the top of the tangle. After some long and ineffective attempts to cross this hazard, your exhaustion forces you to turn back.){MSTR_MAZE_FAILURE_TEXT}
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.

(From beyond the various shapes and shadows of the lush foliage, an evil snickering can be heard, yet you only catch the glimpse of a glowing red pair of eyes. Better to move on before this new danger gets to reveal itself!)
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.

(A glimmer of gold reveals the hilt of a Paladin sword stuck in the stringy flesh of a tree-sized tendril. Plant matter has engulfed the blade, and all efforts to pull it out fail, but it is a good sign regardless. It can’t be far now!)
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.
(A majestic Harrier has chosen this canopy peak as the nesting grounds for its offspring. It immediately prepares to attack, turning your descent into an authentic flight.){MSTR_MAZE_FAILURE_TEXT}
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description. "Harrier" is the name of an in game unit.
(You have scaled the tower of tendrils, and in a moment of deep satisfaction, the thorny barrier recedes, revealing to you the steward of Norzedaal sleeping peacefully amid the green jungle.)
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.

(A silver shimmer between the leaf-top branches catches your attention. There is no doubt it is an Oathbound pendant, as it is customary jewelry amongst some of the Paladins. The pendant is out of your reach to collect, but a good sign regardless. It can’t be far now!)
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.

(With a shrill cry, the Shrikes circling the peaks of the tangle descend on their freshly spotted prey. You could have maybe handled a few of them, but an entire swarm leaves retreat as the only option.){MSTR_MAZE_FAILURE_TEXT}
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description. "Shrike" is the name of an in game unit.
(You hear the splashes of a waterfall in the distance, its constant stream providing a calm, soothing noise.)
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.
(One of your troops carefully approaches the sleeping steward of Norzedaal, giving him a hearty wake-up slap.)
(You slowly approach the sleeping steward of Norzedaal and – decision is decision – carefully kiss him on his forehead.)
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
I..uh… where am I? What happened? I feel like I could eat an entire Megasow for dinner.
Story message. Speaker: "Ashlan of Norzedaal" (Oathbound, male) "Megasow" is the name of an in game unit.
You are at the heart of the Mothernode tangle, where you’ve apparently been sleeping for weeks. I am the new Equis of this planet. We’re here to rescue you.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
The Mothernode… right. It didn’t tell me the communion would take this long. At least this explains all those horrible dreams about tulip harvests – and my newfound appetite for non-vegan food!
Story message. Speaker: "Ashlan of Norzedaal" (Oathbound, male)
The communion? Does this mean you gave your consent to get… sedated and lie down here?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Oh, yes! It was all part of the negotiations, to exchange viewpoints and broaden our horizons. The Mothernode and I agreed to put an end to this needless conflict. Now get me Evans, so he can note down the terms of our new truce…
Story message. Speaker: "Ashlan of Norzedaal" (Oathbound, male)
Evans? I am afraid you are the only survivor we found within the Mothernode tangle, Steward Ashlan.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female) "Evans" is the last name of an Oathbound character of unknown gender (could be male or female).

Those are grim tidings that you bring to me. The Mothernode promised us protection, yet I don’t sense treachery. I hope we can get to the bottom of this, eventually. For now, I pledge to you my services as paladin, Equis {STR_LeaderName}. May your rule bring prosperity to this land!
Story message. Speaker: "Ashlan of Norzedaal" (Oathbound, male)
Thank you, Steward Ashlan. We owe it to your efforts that the village of Norzedaal can be a safer place once more.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

There lies the city of Truchet, centerpiece and home colony of the first Equis Verdrice. He gave his life for its safety, but it would appear that the city has lost much of its previous charm since then. Even the main street looks abandoned and deserted.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female) "Truchet" is the name of a colony.

Oh, foreigner, have you not heard of the terrible curse that has befallen our once fair city? Every night, a shadow takes possession of the streets, spreading despair to even the bravest of hearts. In the morning, yet another member of our community will be missing. And they never return.
Story message. Speaker: "Endaira the Spinstress" (Oathbound, female)

I am shocked to hear about these happenings, good civilian! But as the new Equis of this planet, I do not believe in curses or superstitions. There must be an explanation for what is happening – and I swear that I shall find it!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

You are the new Equis? Then perhaps our prayers have been answered…[br/][br/]But you too will believe in curses once you have witnessed the nightfall. Don’t the Seers curse our enemies as well when they condemn them to fail in battle?
Story message. Speaker: "Endaira the Spinstress" (Oathbound, female)
That is… different. But I shall take your advice and stay in Truchet for the night to keep vigil. No more civilians shall vanish from this city if there is anything I can do about it.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Every night, people go missing in the city of Truchet. You promised to spend the night there and investigate.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: to access quest operations performed on a colony hex, go to the "Colony Center" tab in the colony interface.)[/recommendedcol]
Patrol the streets of Truchet to watch out for anything out of the ordinary.
It’s two hours past nightfall, and the city has turned eerily quiet. The people of Truchet are afraid of what there is to come and have barricaded themselves inside their houses. This is horrible!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

(The clock strikes twelve when a mysterious dark green mist starts spreading through the streets of Truchet. It thickens until one cannot see beyond arm’s length.[br/][br/]A few minutes later, a desperate cry breaks the silence of the night.)
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.
This is the moment of truth. Followers of the Celestian order, channel the light of the stars and let it dissipate the darkness concealing this night’s crime. Now!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Kssssssss! (The lighted streets reveal three hooded figures, one of them a large hulk, carrying a man-sized package. With unnatural speed, they make a run towards the city’s walls.)
Story message. Speaker: "Hooded Figures" (unknown race and genders)
Hold it right there, atrocious criminals! It is time for you to receive your judgment.
Story message. Speaker: "Oathbound Light Bringer" (Oathbound unit, could be any gender)
Fool! (The bulky figure drops the living package, grabs his companions and leaps onto the city wall. Then, with a flash of purple, he hurls his blade at the sack he had left behind and disappears.)
Story message. Speaker: "Hooded Figures" (unknown race and genders)

Brother {STR_LeaderFirstName}, the unknown intruders have escaped into the night! Sadly, the civilian that they tried to abduct almost instantly died from the wound caused by the thrown blade.[br/][br/]How do you want to continue the pursuit?

Sister {STR_LeaderFirstName}, the unknown intruders have escaped into the night! Sadly, the civilian that they tried to abduct almost instantly died from the wound caused by the thrown blade.[br/][br/]How do you want to continue the pursuit?
Story message. Speaker: "Oathbound Light Bringer" (Oathbound unit, could be any gender)
Let a Scryer follow the perpetrators.
Use the chaos blade as a divining rod.
Consult with Vrascal before you respond.
One of our scrying drones has picked up the trail of the fleeing villains, following them from a safe distance. We simply have to wait for them to lead it to their hideout…
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

This blade they left behind is infused with a strange erratic energy. It seems to react to its surroundings, resonating with the entropic field emitted by the dissipating mist. If we use it to track similar technology, it will surely lead us to the villain’s hideout!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
The villains terrorizing the city of Truchet have escaped my Celestian sentries, Vrascal. Tracking them down will be a dangerous task. Once more I am turning to you for advice.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Examinee {STR_LeaderFirstName}, you did well in confronting the perpetrators. They carried the mark of entropy, with no fear of its dangerous applications. Hand me the blade you found. When properly analyzed, it will reveal to us the origin of this new threat.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)
Wait for the Scryer to follow the villains terrorizing the city of Truchet to their hideout.
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Tracking protocol enabled. Following targets into mountainous terrain. Pathfinding algorithm inconclusive: targets are heading in different directions. Calculating highest prior-
Story message. Speaker: "Scryer" (Oathbound drone unit, genderless)
Kssssssss! (The transmitted video footage shows a flash of teal and purple, followed by an impact shake which abruptly ends the transmission.)
Story message. Speaker: "Hooded Figures" (unknown race and genders)

Our scrying drone! They must have noticed they were being followed…[br/][br/]Luckily the Scryer still sent us the projections of their routes through the ravines. If we check their possible destination points one by one, we will surely get back on their tracks.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Your Scryer has been detected and destroyed by the nightstalkers of Truchet. Send your troops to check the different locations within the ravins of the Rugged Mountains to find their hideout.
A task description. "Rugged Mountains" is the name of an in game sector.
Scan the area for residues of entropic fields to find the hideout of the Truchet villains.
No traces of entropic residue; nothing… it looks like this corridor through the mountains is a dead end.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
The readings of entropic potential in this area are off the charts! We have pinpointed the source of the erratic patterns – they lead all the way to the center of the mountain range!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Take some time to examine the chaos blade before using it to track down the Truchet villains.
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.

I have attuned my mind to the chaos blade. It is a cursed piece of technology that feeds on the life force and energy of its victims. The entropic spark of the blade is dwindling. It requires blood. It demands blood.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

The thought of wielding such an unholy relic makes me shudder, but it needs to be done – for the safety of Truchet! Luckily there are many monsters on the Equisat of Verdrice that can serve to recharge the chaos blade without straining my conscience and oath.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
The Chaos Blade needs to recharge its entropic potential before it can used to track other chaos technology. For the blade all kills are good kills.
{INT_0}/{INT_1} Killed 4 units in a single combat with the Chaos Blade equipped
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.

The grim deed has been done; the entropic spark of the chaos blade recharged to full strength. Yes… I can feel it resonating with strong entropic potential at a far distance. Like a compass, it is leading me to the villain’s hideout, which seems to be… all the way at the center of the Rugged Mountains!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Vrascal has taken the chaos blade to analyze it and learn from it the location of the Truchet villain hideout. Assign your other Seers to help him!
Analyze the components of the chaos blade to find its origin.

Examinee {STR_LeaderFirstName}, I have completed the analysis of the chaos blade and communed with Oracle to cross-check its components with the materials existing on this planet. There is no doubt: the hideout of the perpetrators lies at the center of the Rugged Mountains.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)
Thank you, Vrascal. I shall send out my troops immediately. The days of the Truchet villains are numbered!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Venture to the indicated position at the Rugged Mountains and enter the hideout of the Truchet villains.
Once you have all the keys, activate the black obelisk to get into the hideout of the Truchet villains.

Equis {STR_LeaderName}! We have found a black obelisk at the indicated location. It looks like it only serves as an entrance to a larger complex, yet there doesn’t seem to be any opening on the sleek solid surface except for three engraved symbols with circular holes underneath.
Good work, Aspirant! Now please share your display screen with me, so I can take a look at the scene myself…
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

I cannot believe it! These markings clearly resemble the emblems of Truchet, Norzedaal and Dammaster! And the holes below look like they would fit the master keys of an Oathbound steward. This can’t be a coincidence. What in the name of Paladius Joaque is going on here?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Sometimes even a virtuous soul can get corrupted in the presence of a greater malevolence. Find and use the keys, young Examinee, and the truth of this conspiracy will reveal yourself to you.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)

The keys, right… Luckily, as the new Equis, I arrived with the master key of Truchet, the capital. But the keys of Norzedaal and Dammaster are still lost with the two stewards of those villages. We need to find them to be able to activate the obelisk!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

The keys, right… Luckily, as the new Equis, I arrived with the master key of Truchet, the capital. Ashlan of Norzedaal gave me his own when he got rescued, which means we only need to still find the steward of Dammaster before we can activate the obelisk!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

The keys, right… Luckily, as the new Equis, I arrived with the master key of Truchet, the capital. We found the key of Dammaster in the Mycelian lair, which means we only need to still find the steward of Norzedaal before we can activate the obelisk!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

The keys, right… Luckily, as the new Equis, I arrived with the master key of Truchet, the capital. We found the key of Dammaster in the Mycelian lair, and Ashlan of Norzedaal gave me his own when he got rescued. Looks like we are all set to activate the obelisk!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Get ready, everybody! Once the entrance is clear, we will storm in and clear the hideout of the Truchet villains.[br/][br/]I’m putting in key one… two… and three!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
(The obelisk activates, smoothly sinking into the ground, while the entire scenery of surrounding rocks starts to shift, revealing the truth of what was really hidden within the mountains.)
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.
The towers, the battlements, the bridge over nothingness… This isn’t a hideout – it’s a fortress!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Welcome, Equis {STR_LeaderName}, to my humble residence! How accommodating of you to personally escort the next batch of slaves to me. Our mines are in constant need of fresh workforce. They tend to get used up so terribly fast!
Story message. Speaker: "Apostate Tyrant" (marauder unit) Will later reveal himself to be "Equis Verdrice" the former ruler of this planet.
Then you openly admit that you abducted half the population from the city of Truchet and turned them into your private workers? You monster!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Mind you, dear {STR_LeaderFirstName}, not all of them became my slaves. There is always a place for the physically capable and the openminded among my blackguard followers. Take the steward of Dammaster for instance. She had the wisdom to see past the surface and renewed her oath under my tutelage. These fools from Norzedaal on the other hand…

Story message. Speaker: "Apostate Tyrant" (marauder unit) Will later reveal himself to be "Equis Verdrice" the former ruler of this planet. "steward of Dammaster" refers to a female Oathbound character
Continue, villain! Tell me what you did to my companions!
Story message. Speaker: "Ashlan of Norzedaal" (Oathbound, male)

How delightful, the sleeping beauty has finally awoken. You should thank the Mothernode that you didn’t have to share the fate of your troops, pansy. My chaos witches rarely had more fun during their experiments…
Story message. Speaker: "Apostate Tyrant" (marauder unit) Will later reveal himself to be "Equis Verdrice" the former ruler of this planet.

Enough! This displayed celebration of horrors ends now. With the power and commitment that was bestowed upon me by the High Paladius and his Seers, I declare this debauchery to be a threat to the people on the Equisat of Verdrice. Prepare to answer for your crimes, villain!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Your choice of words is intensely amusing, Equis {STR_LeaderFirstName}. But by all means, join me on the stage! After everything I’ve heard about you, it would be a shame if I never got the opportunity to kill you in person…
Story message. Speaker: "Apostate Tyrant" (marauder unit) Will later reveal himself to be "Equis Verdrice" the former ruler of this planet.
The Apostates have abandoned the ways of the Oathbound, twisting Paladin weapons and virtues into evil abominations of themselves. They need to be purged from their tower!

It’s over, villain! Now, before we end this, tell me how you could appropriate and twist around so much of our Oathbound technology? Where did you steal this battlesuit that would have been worthy to be worn by an Equis of the highest esteem?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

You know nothing, little puppet. None of what you see was stolen against law. I merely took what was mine by owing right, all property under my custody, like this warsuit crafted for me, Ergvan Verdrice, Equis and owner of this planet!
Story message. Speaker: "Apostate Tyrant" (marauder unit) Will later reveal himself to be "Equis Verdrice" the former ruler of this planet.

No… this cannot be! Equis Ergvan Verdrice was buried with honors, after he fell in heroic defense against the Voidbringer invasion. I visited his memorial in Truchet. You on the other hand are a tyrant and criminal. No Paladin would ever betray his oath like that!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
The memorial is a farce. Who would want more recognition in death than was given to him in life? And you err, Equis {STR_LeaderFirstName}, in thinking my oath would no longer be intact.

I pledge myself, from now and forever, to the destruction and grief of the weak and the poor. As blackguard, I shall heed the deception of the Seers and foster the voices of power and entropy that will allow me to put myself above others…

Story message. Speaker: "Ergdan Verdrice" (Apostate, male) This is a twisted form of the Paladin oath. Should be translated with that original oath in mind. The oath can be found in the first briefing entry of the ScenarioDefinition_DLC05.xml .
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

…I swear to use this war-suit to sow chaos where the Oathbound construct their false order and to capture the grail configurations of power to liberate the final war. From this day on, I shall be considered an Apostate.

Story message. Speaker: "Ergdan Verdrice" (Apostate, male) This is a twisted form of the Paladin oath. Should be translated with that original oath in mind. The oath can be found in the first briefing entry of the ScenarioDefinition_DLC05.xml .

And as an Apostate you shall die! This one’s for the people of Truchet![br/][br/](A black lance strikes Ergvan Verdrice through the chest, and his body gets disintegrated in a burst of chaotic energy.)
Story message. Speaker: "Narwa of Dammaster" (Oathbound female, the previously mentioned "steward of Damamster")
Forgive me, my Equis, for my courage failing in the contemplation of death. To save myself, I abandoned my oath and my people. Any punishment you deem fair will be justified.
Story message. Speaker: "Narwa of Dammaster" (Oathbound female, the previously mentioned "steward of Damamster")

I sense honest regret in your words. Yet, this planet has seen too much deception and treachery to risk allowing an Apostate rejoin our community. I sentence you to exile, Narwa of Dammaster. May you and your accomplices find peace on the new paths you’ll tread.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
As is your will, my Equis. To uphold our ideals of virtue and chivalry among the outlawed shall be the task of my remaining life. Hopefully, one day we will be ready to return into the light.
Story message. Speaker: "Narwa of Dammaster" (Oathbound female, the previously mentioned "steward of Damamster")

But before I leave, know this: Ergvan Verdrice has made a secret pact with the Assembly. His chaos witches have been using their twisted technology to create a Void barrier around the Assembly’s headquarters to protect whatever it is they are building there. You will need to stop the witches to get in.
Story message. Speaker: "Narwa of Dammaster" (Oathbound female, the previously mentioned "steward of Damamster") "chaos witch" is the name of an in game unit

The code d’Equise teaches us to show compassion and mercy even to our enemies. But you betrayed your oath, Narwa of Dammaster, and for that I shall depose you from your stewardship and demote you to the rank of Warden. As such, you shall have a chance to redeem your actions.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Thank you, my Equis. But before I consign my battlesuit, know this: Ergvan Verdrice has made a secret pact with the Assembly. His chaos witches have been using their twisted technology to create a Void barrier around the Assembly’s headquarters to protect whatever it is they are building there. You will need to stop the witches to get in.
Story message. Speaker: "Narwa of Dammaster" (Oathbound female, the previously mentioned "steward of Damamster") "chaos witch" is the name of an in game unit

It requires great courage to admit one’s mistakes and take full responsibility of your actions. Many would have bended in the face of Ergvan Verdrice’s threats and torture. You deserve a chance to redeem your actions and oath, Narwa of Dammaster. But first you must seek rest among the idyll of the populace and re-learn the importance of their protection.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Thank you, my Equis. But before I leave, know this: Ergvan Verdrice has made a secret pact with the Assembly. His chaos witches have been using their twisted technology to create a Void barrier around the Assembly’s headquarters to protect whatever it is they are building there. You will need to stop the witches to get in.
Story message. Speaker: "Narwa of Dammaster" (Oathbound female, the previously mentioned "steward of Damamster") "chaos witch" is the name of an in game unit
The chaos witches of the Apostates are the one, fueling the Void barrier around T4R0N 0F 960US3 T1MUR's territory with their twisted technology. Time to put an end to their misdoings!
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.

With the wicked witches wiped out, the Void barrier they created is starting to fade away, giving us access to the headquarters of T4R0N and the Assembly.[br/][br/]It is time to write the final chapter of this tale and strike our enemy where he is the most vulnerable!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
This is T4R0N 0F 960US3 T1MUR speaking for the Assembly. Specimens of this planet, do not be alarmed: Reassembly will proceed as scheduled.
Story message. Speaker: "T4R0N 0F 960US3 T1MUR" (Assembly male; previously Syndicate with the name "Taron of House Timur")
Of House Timur? Since when do the Assembly keep track of their noble origins? I thought that all you ever care about is smashing things and then rebuilding them in the wrong order?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

My name is of little importance, subject Theta-39667. I kept it to remind myself of what held me back in the past: human norms, needless etiquette, my sister… Too long have the Syndicate houses been latching on to a past that can never return. Pathetic.
Story message. Speaker: "T4R0N 0F 960US3 T1MUR" (Assembly male; previously Syndicate with the name "Taron of House Timur")

The philosophy of the Assembly, however, I can completely relate to: it if seems broken, break it! And then mend it into something of value. When the Reverse Engineers entered our palace on Jota Timeron, my life was given new purpose. Destructive creationism is our mission and I am its perfect vessel.
Story message. Speaker: "T4R0N 0F 960US3 T1MUR" (Assembly male; previously Syndicate with the name "Taron of House Timur") "Jota Timeron" is the name of a planet.

It is hard to believe that such a wretched existence can be enjoyed. But listen, T4R0N of the Assembly: this planet is under the vowed protection of the Oathbound. Try to harm but one of its citizens, and I shall meet you on the field of battle.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

With pleasure. Your advanced battlesuits are still a novelty amongst our scavengers. I am sure such a unique trophy will inspire me to turn you into a masterpiece creation. You will thank me when it is finished.
Story message. Speaker: "T4R0N 0F 960US3 T1MUR" (Assembly male; previously Syndicate with the name "Taron of House Timur") "scavenger" is the name of an Assembly unit
A header name of a task.
T4R0N 0F 960US3 T1MUR has made it clear that he hasn't come to the Equisat of Verdrice with peaceful intentions. Your colonies won't be safe until he and his troops are driven off the planet.
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.

The omnipresence of the Assembly on so many different worlds is a reason to worry. It seems their plans of galactic conquest are meeting less and less resistance by the day. Driving them off the Equisat of Verdrice will be tough, but we need to believe in our strength.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
War is upon us, whether we want it or not. What is your advice, Vrascal? How can we contain the Assembly without risking severe losses?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Keep the fighting away from your colonies, Examinee {STR_LeaderFirstName}, and many civilians can be spared. You have the weapons to lead an assault and strike first, but be wary: the Assembly’s main host is safeguarded by a fissure within the Void and cannot be beaten.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)
What do you mean, “cannot be beaten”? This is a war, not some game of chess where surrendering could be an option.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Patience, Examinee {STR_LeaderFirstName}. Consulting with Oracle is a delicate art that demands time. As we learn more about our enemy, we will learn more about how we can combat their defensive systems. Knowledge is the key.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)

For now, we can take advantage of the Assembly’s trust in the technology that isn’t even their own. Here is a list of rare psycho-reactive items and where to find them. Collect them, and we can start on combating the Assembly threat.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)

The hippocampus of a Mad Preacher? Distilled psychedelic substrate from a Flowering Node? Brain-purulence of a Kir’Ko Tormented? How foul![br/][br/]What kind of witch-poison do you want to brew with all that? And how does any of this help me with the Assembly?

Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female) "Mad Preacher" is the name of a Spacer unit. "Flowering Node" is the name of a Growth unit. "Tormented" is the name of a Kir'Ko unit.
Don’t doubt, Examinee {STR_LeaderFirstName}. Believe. The wisdom of Oracle can’t always easily be explained.[br/][br/]Oh, and one more thing: the ingredients need to be fresh!
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)

Vrascal has asked you to collect a number of very specific substances, which will supposedly help in the upcoming conflict with the Assembly.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: to access quest operations performed on a colony hex, go to the "Colony Center" tab in the colony interface.)[/recommendedcol]
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Combine the collected ingredients, using Vrascal's notes as help.

For Vrascal's elixir you need to find distilled psychedelic substrate from a Flowering Node. You could try to recruit one to get the substance in good terms, or slowly collect it during your fights with the Growth.
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
For Vrascal's elixir you need to collect the hippocampus of a Mad Preacher. Sounds gruesome, but at least it will also protect your colonies from the Spacer Guild raiding the territory.

For Vrascal's elixir you need to collect brain-purulence from a Kir'Ko Tormented. One of these poor creatures still haunted by past Star Union misdoings has been sighted in the area of your headquarters.

It is good to see that you have collected everything I have asked you for. The ingredients are processed and filled up in the appropriate flasks. Now you only have to brew them together in the right order.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)
Me? Wouldn’t this task be more appropriate for someone with a talent for… potions? Like yourself?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
I have important preparations to make, Examinee {STR_LeaderFirstName}. The instructions have been readied for you. It’s really not that complicated.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)

Five flasks stand readied at the experimental table:[br/][br/][strengthbio/] Flask 1 contains green powder.[br/][strengthwave/] Flask 2 has a blue gooey liquid inside.[br/][strengthpsyche/] Flask 3 contains pink liquid, which is labelled as neuro-toxic.[br/][strengththermal/] Flask 4 glows red with luminescent lotion.[br/][tricorium/] Flask 5 encloses a powder black as Cosmite.[spacedline/][br/][br/]Vrascal’s instructions say the following:[br/][br/]1. The pink liquid [strengthpsyche/] evaporates if it can’t react with another agent.[br/]2. The blue liquid [strengthwave/] needs to be added before the green powder [strengthbio/], but after the red liquid [strengththermal/].[br/]3. No two liquids may be added directly after another.[br/][br/]You ponder for some time and then decide to first use…
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.
An ingredient which will get inserted into an ingredient list.
An ingredient which will get inserted into an ingredient list.
An ingredient which will get inserted into an ingredient list.
An ingredient which will get inserted into an ingredient list.
An ingredient which will get inserted into an ingredient list.
This is a string variable that will be replaced in game with a different string. Please don't translate or transcribe.
This is a string variable that will be replaced in game with a different string. Please don't translate or transcribe.
This is a string variable that will be replaced in game with a different string. Please don't translate or transcribe.
This is a string variable that will be replaced in game with a different string. Please don't translate or transcribe.
{MSTR_OATH01_ELIXIR_FIRST_INGREDIENT} is put into Vrascal’s Cauldron. Not much is happening yet.[br/][br/]Next you use…
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.

A rotten smell is starting to spread in the Laboratory. Inside the Cauldron there is:[br/]{MSTR_OATH01_ELIXIR_FIRST_INGREDIENT}.[br/]{MSTR_OATH01_ELIXIR_SECOND_INGREDIENT}.[br/][br/]You continue with…
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.

The mixture inside Vrascal’s cauldron fizzles and foams. Inside there is:[br/]{MSTR_OATH01_ELIXIR_FIRST_INGREDIENT}.[br/]{MSTR_OATH01_ELIXIR_SECOND_INGREDIENT}.[br/]{MSTR_OATH01_ELIXIR_THIRD_INGREDIENT}.[br/][br/]Your next pick is…
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.

Bubbles are emerging one by one from the surface of the substance. Inside the Cauldron there is:[br/]{MSTR_OATH01_ELIXIR_FIRST_INGREDIENT}.[br/]{MSTR_OATH01_ELIXIR_SECOND_INGREDIENT}.[br/]{MSTR_OATH01_ELIXIR_THIRD_INGREDIENT}.[br/]{MSTR_OATH01_ELIXIR_FOURTH_INGREDIENT}.[br/][br/]With only one ingredient left you use…
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.

The mixture inside the cauldron changes color various times until it glistens in all the tinted shades of the rainbow, much like soap bubbles. Surprisingly enough, everything inside the lab survived your experimentation.
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.

You have finished the elixir. Impressive! I have seen many brave Paladins fail and quail in the light of a simple laboratory task.[br/][br/]In the meantime, two of our Scryers have been modified to spread the elixir at the right location and time. Now the only thing left to do is sit back and watch.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)

The substance you brewed together violently erupts and bursts in flames. After leaping into cover and sitting out the reaction, you find there is nothing left inside the cauldron except grime and a smell of charred skin.
Story message. No speaker. This is a scene description.
Let your Seer scientists solve this problem.
Let your Seer scientists find the right order of ingredients and brew the elixir that Vrascal asked you to make.
Adding five ingredients in the right order shouldn't be too difficult, right?
Spraying elixir “Assembly’s curse” at all programmed locations. Scent particle density in the area is reaching the critical threshold…
Story message. Speaker: "Scryer" (Oathbound drone unit, genderless)
Mellow vibrations… delicious sounds of white energy slopping over the cosmic shores. K’Chru hear and eat. A short walk… and we can satiate… more.

Shoals of Psi-Fish are emerging from the Void barrier, swarming over the Assembly colonies. It seems they have been attracted by the substance we have been brewing together. If our elixir was their appetizer, the Assembly are now their main dish. What a severe blow against our enemy!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

The other participating Paladins have reached the planets of their protection, Examinee {STR_LeaderFirstName}, and are ready for the Calling of Bravery to commence. They are sending you their regards in a timed transmission.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male) "Calling of Bravery" is the name of a competition.

Dear Equis {STR_LeaderName} and Equis Denard, it is an uplifting feeling to know that the two of you are venturing out to fulfill your chivalrous duties and serve the populace and its needs with the purest of hearts. May your swords strike ever-truthfully and continue to write the legend of the Oathbound Paladins.
Story message. Speaker: "Equis Burceau" (Oathbound male) "Equis Denard" is the title and last name of a male Oathbound character.

Thank you, Equis Burceau. It is indeed an honor for the two of you to witness my greatest achievements yet to come. I will make sure to let my heralds pass on the tales of my triumphs to you, so you may enjoy the benefit of being able to learn from the best.
Story message. Speaker: "Equis Denard" (Oathbound male) "Equis Burceau" is the title and last name of a male Oathbound character.

Equis Burceau, your noble teachings are a true inspiration for even the most accomplished Paladins. I hope to see you take your well-deserved place in the Circle of Heroes eventually.[br/][br/]Equis Denard, your courage and victories on the field are legendary and worthy of true admiration. There seems to be no challenge too great for you to master.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

As for myself, I give this promise to the people on the Equisat of Verdrice: my heart shall not find rest while even a single soul under my vowed protection is still living in fear or bale.[br/][br/]May all our actions continue to spread the light in this dark universe.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Examinee {STR_LeaderFirstName}, there is another incoming transmission from Equis Denard. He insisted in putting it through to you.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)

To the spectators of my triumph: by the time this message reaches you, I shall have already expunged 4 Hopperhound Dens, 2 Quartzite Nests and slain the Great Worm of Leddigor Island. You may all clap your hands and stand in awe of my admirable deeds.

Story message. Speaker: "Equis Denard" (Oathbound male) "Hopperhound Den" is the name of an in game structure. "Qzartizte Nest" is the name of an in game structure. "Leddigor Island" is the name of an island.

It is good to hear that you are faring well on your adventures, Equis Denard. I myself need to shield my loyal citizens from an equally dangerous foe. The Assembly dropped from the sky with their barges of half-dead organ harvesters. They cannot be reasoned with.
That is grim news, Equis Burceau! May your lance prevail and push those terrifying cyborgs back to the wastelands from whence they came!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Examinee {STR_LeaderFirstName}, there is yet another transmission from Equis Denard. He seems more than eager to share his progress.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)
Bravely bold Equis Denard[br/]flew forth from Elbersted.[br/]He was not afraid to die, brave Equis Denard.[br/]He was not at all afraid to kill monsters many ways,[br/]brave brave brave Equis Denard.
Story message. Speaker: "Equis Denard" (Oathbound male) This is a nod to the song "bravely bold Syr Robin" in "Monthy Python and the holy grail".

When the Assembly reared its ugly head,[br/]he bravely rescued Elbersted.[br/]Yes, Equis Denard took them on[br/]and gallantly saved everyone![br/]With sword and shield and iron feet[br/]he made the Assembly retreat![br/]Bravest of the brave, Equis Denard!
Story message. Speaker: "Equis Denard" (Oathbound male) This is a nod to the song "bravely bold Syr Robin" in "Monthy Python and the holy grail".

I applaud you, Equis Denard, to this victory over the Assembly! More and more planets are being threatened by their plans of world domination.[br/][br/]I am sure Equis Burceau will be interested to hear, in detail, which weapons and strategies helped you prevail.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

A Paladin’s greatest weapon is his courage! But the battle for the Equisat of Denard is not over yet. The Assembly keep resisting my glorious charge, though undoubtedly not for long! I can indeed give plenty of advice to you, Equis Burceau.[br/][br/]Equis Burceau…?

Equis Burceau is not available to answer your questions at this moment. And frankly he will stay busy for quite a while. We need every disposable individual to set up the L0G3N-Shaw Grapple on this planet.
Story message. Speaker: "6R0XA-4" (Assembly, female) "L0G3N-Shaw Grapple" is the name of a huge in story device.
You monsters! Don’t think your aggressive expansion will grant you any lasting victories! We will keep resisting!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Resist all you like. For the Assembly, disconnected body parts are just as valuable as the entire subject. Reassembly will come to everyone. Make your choice of whether it will happen to you sooner or later.
Story message. Speaker: "6R0XA-4" (Assembly, female) "Reassembly" is the name of the process when a non-Assembly person gets turned into an Assembly.
Examinee {STR_LeaderFirstName}, there is word from Equis Denard. He has news for you regarding the Assembly.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)

Worry not, Equis {STR_LeaderName}. While it does not avenge what happened to the poor Equis Burceau, I have vanquished the Assembly and removed them from my planet for good! Now my Seer judge is investigating the strange Void device which they activated.
But in the meantime, my exceptional talents are needed elsewhere. I have been summoned to Archanon-8 to come before the Circle of Heroes. Not that there was any doubt this would happen.
Story message. Speaker: "Equis Denard" (Oathbound male) "Archanon-8" is the name of a planet. For "Circle of Heroes" see the corresponding glossary entry.

Oh, what a pleasant... well, it was not a surprise, apparently! I wish you the best of luck on this new journey, Equis Denard.[br/][br/]What does this mean for me, Vrascal? Has the Calling of Bravery ended?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

The Calling of Bravery was first and foremost a test of skill and virtue. Every participant knew the possible reward was not the key. After Equis Burceau’s heroic death, it has been decided to suspend the competition. This doesn’t change your duties nor my role as observant. If all goes well, you too may still get invited to the Circle.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)
Give it up, T4R0N 0F 960S3 T1MUR! Hand over your weapons, and the lives of your remaining troops can be spared.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Your self-assurance amuses me! Why should I surrender now, when the hour of our greatest triumph is near? For soon the United Generations of the Assembly will lay their claim on nothing less than Union Prime itself!

Story message. Speaker: "T4R0N 0F 960US3 T1MUR" (Assembly male; previously Syndicate with the name "Taron of House Timur") "United Generations of the Assembly" is the name of a galactic empire. "Union Prime" is the name of a planet.
Union Prime, the capital world that was created to rule them all? You are delusional! The planet has been devoured by the Calaclysm and is lost for all eternity.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female) For "Cataclysm" see the corresponding glossary entry.

There is no limit to the Assembly’s potential, subject Theta-39667. With the help of the data provided by our Apostate allies we discovered that Union Prime still exists within the Void. It is lingering there, in cosmic stasis, like a stranded whale waiting to get pulled back into the ocean.
Story message. Speaker: "T4R0N 0F 960US3 T1MUR" (Assembly male; previously Syndicate with the name "Taron of House Timur")
Now behold and witness the activation of the L0G3N-Shaw Grapple. Where one cord fails, the combined strength of a million will lift up even a colossus!
Story message. Speaker: "T4R0N 0F 960US3 T1MUR" (Assembly male; previously Syndicate with the name "Taron of House Timur") "L0G3N-Shaw Grapple" is the name of a huge in story device.
The tremors, the permanent lightning from the Void… it is just like the other Paladins described. I am beginning to understand… the Equisat of Verdrice is not even your target – it is just an anchor!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Very good! Your brain may be of some use to us after all! You are too late to stop us, subject Theta-39667. Join us or fight us – Reassembly awaits, one way or another.
Story message. Speaker: "T4R0N 0F 960US3 T1MUR" (Assembly male; previously Syndicate with the name "Taron of House Timur")
T4R0N and his Assembly are no longer, yet there is little reason for celebration. The people of this world cannot be considered safe while their planet is chained to the Void with an energy lash.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Still, you did well, Examinee {STR_LeaderFirstName}. I have forwarded my compilation of your deeds and findings to the High Paladius. He is requesting your presence on Archanon-8.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male) For "High Paladius" see the corresponding glossary entry.
Archanon-8… the seat of the Circle – and Oracle. I am honored to receive such a generous invitation. But I must decline – the people of this planet need my protection!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Your abilities have been deemed apt to serve a greater good, Equis {STR_LeaderName}. Accept this new calling! There are other Paladins, who can carry on your duties here, while the Void anchors of the Assembly are a responsibility best left to us Seers.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)
And one last thing before we part: the base of the Assembly holds important fragments of their Void technology. It could proof useful for you in the challenges ahead.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)

Thank you, Vrascal. I wouldn’t have made it here without your counsel. The Celestian teachings will always stay a part of who I am, but I must prepare for the next time I will face the Assembly. Their Voidtech machinery shall not surprise us a second time.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Thank you, Vrascal. I wouldn’t have made it here without your counsel. But this time, I must stay true to my Celestian roots. They are the source of my courage and inner strength, and my best protection in the ongoing war with the Assembly.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
A header name of a task.
Light of the stars,[br/]give a voice to my thoughts[br/]and clarity to my mind.[br/]Let me leave this carnal prison behind[br/]and travel to the heart of an enlightened soul.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Reverend Nacri… I know I should not disturb your peace from this far a distance, but I am in need of your wisdom and guidance.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Prentice {STR_LeaderFirstName}. Evidently you are still in the best command of your exceptional talents. Only a few people within our order have ever mastered the ability to project a psionic link to another planet.[br/][br/]So, your visions have returned?
Story message. Speaker: "Reverend Nacri" (Celestian Ascended Teacher unit, male)

Yes, Reverend, and they felt more lifelike than ever before. Yet, I couldn’t recall any of their content when I awoke. You once told me that the Kir’Ko have Dream Readers to help their people discern the meaning of their ancestral dreams. Maybe you could guide me through my visions in a similar way?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female) For "Dream Reader" see the corresponding glossary entry.

The psionic techniques of the Kir’Ko are a unique subject worthy of study, though nigh inaccessible for other races. You should put more trust in the meditation methods developed by our order. When followed truthfully, they will guide you into the light that you seek.
Story message. Speaker: "Reverend Nacri" (Celestian Ascended Teacher unit, male)
Find a tranquil place to meditate in the Celestian ways and recall the recurring dreams that have been troubling your mind.
Sit down in the meadow to meditate.
I can sense that you have managed to return to your last vision. What did you see?
Story message. Speaker: "Reverend Nacri" (Celestian Ascended Teacher unit, male)

It felt like a memory from when I was still a little boy. I was playing in the fields together with some children from the neighborhood. I was joyful until my parents called me in for dinner and I noticed that I had lost my favorite toy. My parents even went with me to the fields to look, but it was gone.

It felt like a memory from when I was still a little girl. I was playing in the fields together with some children from the neighborhood. I was joyful until my parents called me in for dinner and I noticed that I had lost my favorite toy. My parents even went with me to the fields to look, but it was gone.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
The strangest thing is that I do not recognize any of the places or people I saw. Not even my supposed parents.[br/][br/]Is it possible that I inherited someone else’s memories?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Passing on something as complex and yet vague as a memory would require carefully honed psionic skills. More often the dreams and visions of a psionic user are projections of that person’s own hopes and fears.[br/][br/]You say you lost something in that vision. What was it?
Story message. Speaker: "Reverend Nacri" (Celestian Ascended Teacher unit, male)
Interesting. Very interesting.[br/][br/]Then why don’t you search for it on your current planet?
Story message. Speaker: "Reverend Nacri" (Celestian Ascended Teacher unit, male)
Here? On the Equisat of Verdrice? But my dream could have played on any planet at any time during the past few hundred years…
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
It doesn’t matter. As long as you connect with your vision, it will lead you where you need to be.
Story message. Speaker: "Reverend Nacri" (Celestian Ascended Teacher unit, male)
Your Celestian mentor Reverend Nacri has encouraged you to follow up on your strange visions and search for the lost toy from your dream.
It is unclear how this could happen, but it seems your psionic potential has given physical shape to the toy car from your vision. Except it looks much bigger and dangerous.
Who’s that? Tryin’ to be a tough boy, ‘ey? Well guess what, I didn’t pimp the engine of my thresher to let a noob spoil the fun! Thrashing time!
Who’s that? Tryin’ to be a tough girl, ‘ey? Well guess what, I didn’t pimp the engine of my thresher to let a noob spoil the fun! Thrashing time!
It is unclear how this could happen, but it seems your psionic potential has given physical shape to the toy doll from your vision. Except it looks much bigger and dangerous.

Oh, so you thought I was only a doll that couldn’t think or talk? That’s what they all say! Don’t try to apologize; my memory disks know all the fetishes and perversions your human brain could devise. I’ve seen them all!
Story message. Speaker: "Emma-4" (in game unit, female android)
It is unclear how this could happen, but it seems your psionic potential has given physical shape to the toy frog from your vision. Except it looks much bigger and dangerous.
(The frog-like creature stares at you with its large empty eyes. It surely is bigger and less plushy than you remember from the vision. Just now it casually swallows a deer-fly. Guess who is next?)
I’ve confronted the embodiment of the toy from my dream, still none of it seems to make sense. Why would I feel sad about losing something I never possessed?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Do you? Not just your Celestian brothers and sisters have revoked their property…
Story message. Speaker: "Reverend Nacri" (Celestian Ascended Teacher unit, male)

You mean the dream was a reflection of my Paladin vow of humility? That it communicates my fear of giving up the few things I am still allowed to possess? I always valued the third noble command for protecting me from the corruption of wealth.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
It might have been. But it could just as well allude to a different, bigger mystery within your mind.[br/][br/]Rest now, Prentice {STR_LeaderFirstName}. The truth is made for the patient.
Story message. Speaker: "Reverend Nacri" (Celestian Ascended Teacher unit, male)
No! Let go, you mean people! Don’t take me away from my mommy…

Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female) Spoken from the perspective of a young girl (it is a first person vision / dream), even if Aliuna is male because of player customization!
Prentice {STR_LeaderFirstName}! Wake up! You are only having a bad dream!
Story message. Speaker: "Reverend Nacri" (Celestian Ascended Teacher unit, male)
Reverend Nacri? Did I contact you from my sleep? I didn’t know that was possible…
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
You are full of surprising talents, it seems. Now take a deep breath and tell me what you experienced within this new dream vision.
Story message. Speaker: "Reverend Nacri" (Celestian Ascended Teacher unit, male)

I was the same girl as last time, only a little bit older. It was a normal day, until the men in uniform came to our house. They had a long talk with my parents… and then they took me away from them! It was horrible!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
They said they would take me to a better place, where I would receive the same glittering implants that they’ve been wearing. But all I wanted was to stay with my parents!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Glittering implants you say? Are you sure your brain didn’t just project the Assembly threat to reassemble this planet onto your dreams?
Story message. Speaker: "Reverend Nacri" (Celestian Ascended Teacher unit, male)
Yes, I am sure. They didn’t look like Assembly. Their cybernetic implants were far too sleek and pristine. I imagine it’s what the Paragon must have used before the Star Union fell.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Pre-collapse Paragon? Very curious. But if you want to find out more, you will have to confront those reflections of your inner fears. Remember that a man’s greatest enemy can be his own mind.
Story message. Speaker: "Reverend Nacri" (Celestian Ascended Teacher unit, male)
Face the figures from your dream to learn about and conquer your own fears.

I think I am beginning to understand. As an orphan, the Celestian order was the only family I ever knew. I didn’t realize it until now, but I never truly got over leaving you all behind when I started my training as an Oathbound Paladin. If the first dream represented my fear of losing property, this one clearly represents my fear of losing the people I care about.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Very good! You are slowly exploring the hidden regions of your mind. It is a journey that can become a part of who you are for the rest of your life.
Story message. Speaker: "Reverend Nacri" (Celestian Ascended Teacher unit, male)

But one thing still truly scares me: it can’t be normal that my dreams start taking physical form in such ways, can it? Summoning denizens of the Abyss is something only followers of the Psynumbra should be able to do.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Is it summoning, or is it attracting? Evil can seek out the innocent, especially when they show signs of remarkable psionic talents such as you do. Stay cautious, Prentice {STR_LeaderFirstName}. Stay vigilant. The light of the Celestian path will not fail you.
Story message. Speaker: "Reverend Nacri" (Celestian Ascended Teacher unit, male)

…but I don’t want to solve the conflict between the Outlanders and Terratech. This game is too hard! I want to play a real game with real friends! Not sit around your lifeless holograms. All they ever want is exercise, exercise, exercise…
